verses.plain: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

tokens.t: Moreover the
answered Job, and said,

verses.plain: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

tokens.t: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct
? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

verses.plain: ¶ Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

tokens.t: ¶ Then Job answered the
, and said,

verses.plain: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

tokens.t: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

verses.plain: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

tokens.t: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

verses.plain: ¶ Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

tokens.t: ¶ Then answered the
unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

verses.plain: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

tokens.t: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

verses.plain: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

tokens.t: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

verses.plain: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

tokens.t: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

verses.plain: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

tokens.t: Deck thyself now
majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

verses.plain: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

tokens.t: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one
proud, and abase him.

verses.plain: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

tokens.t: Look on every one
proud,
bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

verses.plain: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

tokens.t: Hide them in the dust together;
bind their faces in secret.

verses.plain: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

tokens.t: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

verses.plain: ¶ Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

tokens.t: ¶ Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

verses.plain: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

tokens.t: Lo now, his strength
in his loins, and his force
in the navel of his belly.

verses.plain: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

tokens.t: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

verses.plain: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

tokens.t: His bones
strong pieces of brass; his bones
like bars of iron.

verses.plain: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

tokens.t: He
the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach

verses.plain: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

tokens.t: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

verses.plain: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

tokens.t: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

verses.plain: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

tokens.t: The shady trees cover him
their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

verses.plain: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

tokens.t: Behold, he drinketh up a river,
hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

verses.plain: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.

tokens.t: He taketh it with his eyes:
nose pierceth through snares.

footnotes.text: behemoth: probably an extinct animal of some kind
he drinketh up: Heb. he oppresseth
He…: or, Will any take him in his sight, or, bore his nose with a gin?
